intro: Platyloma intramarginale, commonly known as the margin-leaf platyloma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, with the leaves having a unique margin that extends beyond the main blade. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
